sentences.english: But most assume it would boost the Lib Dems.
sentences.chinese: 但是大多数认为这会有利于自民党的发展。

sentences.english: Australian Liberal Democratic Party's President Huang Zhaoqiang met and praised Zhao for his philanthropic undertaking.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲自民党主席黄肇强都接见并表扬了赵尚阳的善举。

sentences.english: It would be a pity for Japan if the Liberal Democrats gave up without a fight, however.
sentences.chinese: 倘若自民党不战而败，对日本而言，实属憾事。

sentences.english: Yet LDP rule in its present form is in terminal decline.
sentences.chinese: 然而，自民党现今的统治方式已病入膏荒。

sentences.english: Japan's LDP leadership plans to give Hamada "removal" action.
sentences.chinese: 日本自民党领导层计划给予滨田“除名”处分。

sentences.english: This feature is obvious in the conflicts of factions of Free Democratic Party.
sentences.chinese: 这一点在战后的自民党派阀斗争中表现特别明显。

sentences.english: Without one, the LDP will continue to get pummeled at the ballot box.
sentences.chinese: 没有这样的计划，自民党将继续遭遇选举挫折。

sentences.english: Some 80% of LDP candidates who received New Komeito endorsement this time around were elected.
sentences.chinese: 获公明党支持的自民党候选人中有八成当选。

sentences.english: The Liberal Democrats' high command denied that he was thinking of defecting.
sentences.chinese: 自民党最高指挥部否认肯尼迪考虑叛变的消息。

sentences.english: Tanigaki refused on the grounds that the LDP does not eliminate policy differences with the Democratic Party.
sentences.chinese: 谷垣拒绝，理由是自民党与民主党未消弭政策分歧。

sentences.english: But perhaps the Lib Dems’ clout on issues such as counter-terrorism should not be so surprising.
sentences.chinese: 不应对自民党影响一些诸如反恐的问题感到如此惊奇。

sentences.english: The election is really about whether the LDP’s time is up.
sentences.chinese: 此次大选的确关乎着是否自民党的大限已到。

sentences.english: Polls show the party faces a close race in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 投票显示，自民党在东京面临着难分胜负的竞赛。

definition: Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
KOIKE Yuriko (1952-), Japanese LDP politician, minister of defense during 2008
MORI Yoshirō (1937-), Japanese rugby player and politician, prime minister 2000-2001, famous for numerous gaffes
Noda Yoshihiko, Prime Minister of Japan (2 September 2011 ~)
abbr. for 參議院|参议院[can1 yi4 yuan4], senate/upper chamber (of legislative assembly)
